RoboticPlatformWindow Class Reference

Base class for all Robotic Platform windows. More...

#include <RoboticPlatformWindow.hpp>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base class for all Robotic Platform windows.

All windows of the Robotic Platform GUI (e.g., control panels, the scene viewer GUI) are derived from the class RoboticPlatformWindow. This classes stores a list of all windows that can be retrieved for various purposes.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: GuiClasses
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Mon May 21 15:18:45 GMT 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: RoboticPlatformWindow.t.cpp
// Example program for the class RoboticPlatformWindow.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>
#include <stdio.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatformWindow.hpp"
#include "QWidgets.hpp"



Barrier g_barrier(2);
 
 
class MyWindow : public RoboticPlatformWindow, public CWindow
{
 public:
  MyWindow(const char *title)
    : CWindow(0, (char *) title, 300, 100) {}
};
 
 
//======================================================================== 
// thread
//========================================================================  

void *thread(void *)
{
  PtInit(0);

  for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++)
  {
    char text[200];
    sprintf(text, "Robotic Platform Window %d", i);
    MyWindow *window = new MyWindow(text);
    window->realize();
    window->setSelectableOn();
  }
  
  RoboticPlatformWindow::setLastWindowCloseBarrier(&g_barrier);
  
  PtMainLoop();
}


//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main()
{
  pthread_create(0, 0, thread, 0);

  cout << "Waiting for close of all windows" << endl;
  g_barrier.wait();
  cout << "terminating" << endl;

  return 0;
}
